item.title: Australian Submarine Agency lobbies Fremantle locals amid protest over AUKUS defence hub
item.description: A push to earn the public's trust over a defence hub south of Perth by the Australian Submarine Agency draws protesters and sceptical residents in Fremantle.

item.title: Warm currents bring tens of thousands of giant yellowfin tuna to NSW South Coast
item.description: Fishers are reporting an unprecedented number of yellowfin tuna travelling from the tropics to the NSW South Coast, causing "mayhem" and excitement.

item.title: NT Director of Public Prosecutions files appeal against Jake Danby fatal hit-and-run sentence
item.description: The NT's Director of Public Prosecutions has filed an appeal against the sentence of hit-and-run driver Jake Danby, who killed one Aboriginal man and injured another.

item.title: Gardens of Stone State Conservation Area walks open path to incredible vistas
item.description: New South Wales National Parks and Wildlife staff have spent 18 months transforming eroded vehicle trails into rehabilitated walks, opening previously inaccessible viewpoints.

item.title: QCOAL's Cook Colliery coal mine in central Queensland to close half of operation
item.description: A third Queensland coal miner has confirmed job cuts as it prepares to close one of its underground mine sites, with the company also putting the blame on rising costs and state government royalties.

item.title: Rabbits cause 'devastating' damage to Junee cemetery in southern NSW
item.description: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

item.title: Asbestos discovery further delays Willyama High School demolition
item.description: Nearly two years after a mould-infested high school was closed indefinitely, high-risk friable asbestos has caused further delays to its demolition.

item.description: The 43-year-old man was found guilty of attacking his partner, despite her having withdrawn her complaint against him.

item.title: Bruce Lehrmann likely to face four-day hearing in Tasmania over motor vehicle stealing charge
item.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in the Hobart Magistrates Court after pleading not guilty to one count of motor vehicle stealing.

item.title: Green Gravity secures old coal mine shaft to test gravitational energy storage
item.description: A disused coal mine in Wollongong will be the first test site for a renewable energy company that lowers weights down old mine shafts to spin turbines and create electricity.

item.title: China urges Papua New Guinea not to exclude other countries after it signed 'Pukpuk' communique with Australia
item.description: China has urged Papua New Guinea not to sign any deal that might exclude or restrict third parties from cooperating with the Pacific nation, as Australia scrambles to clinch a landmark defence treaty.

item.title: Matthew Draganoff sentenced for murder of tenant
item.description: A man who was found guilty of the "execution-style murder" of his "unarmed" tenant on the northern outskirts of Adelaide has been jailed for at least 28 years.

item.description: As the men's Ashes approaches, the Australian captain reveals his hopes for taking part in the five-Test series against England as he steps up his injury recovery.

item.title: Cowboys prepare to make NRLW finals debut against Sharks in Townsville
item.description: As the Cowboys eye the path to premiership glory ahead of their sudden-death semifinal against the Sharks, they are also creating pathways off field for the next generation of NRLW stars.

item.title: Ex-Greens candidate Hannah Thomas injured in pro-Palestinian protest awarded $22k over dropped case

item.title: Hakyung Lee, mother accused of killing children, had a 'disease of the mind', defence expert tells court
item.description: Hakyung Lee has been charged with murdering her children and has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity after leaving their bodies in an Auckland storage facility.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Interview with Chris Bowen
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Climate change minister rules out mandating EV sales
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cockchafer worm wreaking havoc on West Australian grain crops
item.description: Growers and scientists have teamed up in a bid to combat the rapidly increasing population of the voracious pest, which is devastating crops in WA's south-east.

item.title: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90 per cent
item.description: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

item.title: Symbio Wildlife Park emu chicks being raised by hens after father walks out
item.description: Birds of a different feather are flocking together at a wildlife park in New South Wales, where the chickens have been given the responsibility of being foster parents to a pair of abandoned emu chicks.

item.title: From the Couch
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: White House says the new $100k H-1B visa fee won't apply to existing holders
item.description: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland
item.description: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

item.title: Crocodiles on the move in northern Australia as breeding season arrives
item.description: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

item.title: Optus outage 'unlikely' to have caused baby's death, police say, but impact spreads to NSW
item.description: Optus reveals that in addition to customers in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, two people in New South Wales were unable to connect to emergency services during the 13-hour outage last Thursday.

item.title: Life on Aboriginal reserve remembered by Carnarvon traditional owners
item.description: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: How Brisbane, Hawthorn, Geelong and Collingwood stay on top of the AFL world
item.description: The 21st century has been dominated by four AFL clubs — Geelong, Hawthorn, Collingwood and Brisbane — but there's no single secret to their success.

item.title: Penola High School's agriculture program revives community and enrolments
item.description: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

item.title: Explaining Aussie driving culture to make roads safer for recent arrivals
item.description: Driving a car or riding a bike may be essential for temporary migrants studying or working in Australia, but hook turns, wombat crossings, and roundabouts can be unfamiliar territory. Here are some locals working to change that.

item.title: Cats star Tyson Stengle desperate to win second AFL premiership
item.description: Three years after Tyson Stengle capped off his remarkable AFL career resurrection with a premiership, the Geelong forward believes a second premiership would hold greater significance.

item.title: WA police investigate after man found with critical injuries dies on Kalgoorlie street
item.description: Detectives from the Major Crime Division are investigating the death near a popular park in the Goldfields city early on Sunday morning.

item.title: Optus failed to follow 'protocols' in not notifying police about outage sooner, WA deputy premier says
item.description: Optus failed to follow protocol after it only contacted WA Police late Thursday evening about an outage affecting triple-0 calls, Acting Premier Rita Saffioti says.

item.title: Penrith Panthers hammer Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs to keep NRL premiership five-peat hopes alive
item.description: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

item.title: Demons defeat Eagles as Crows, Giants, Lions and Saints score AFLW wins
item.description: The Demons' Eden Zanker enjoys a day out with five goals to help defeat Daisy Pearce's young Eagles squad by 51 points, while the Crows launch a final-quarter fightback to get past the Suns.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: Optus CEO confirms further customer report calls, service outage at NSW-SA border.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dayne Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Mason Cox's glasses in Lions' win over Magpies
item.description: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

item.title: Household consumption is rebounding, but can we dodge a recession?
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri crashes on lap one, Max Verstappen wins in Baku
item.description: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

item.title: Penrith's win over Canterbury was a reminder there is no team like them
item.description: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.

item.title: Nicola Olyslagers wins high jump gold, Ky Robinson comes fourth in 5,000m on rain-hit final day of World Athletics Championships
item.description: Nicola Olyslagers won a superb gold medal in a women's high jump that was twice suspended for torrential rain on the final day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Can recognising the state of Palestine achieve a two-state solution as Israel continues bombing Gaza?
item.description: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.

item.title: Is artificial intelligence overhyped or is AI the 'fourth industrial revolution'?
item.description: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

item.title: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for basic care at home under aged care changes
item.description: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

item.title: Gene editing is being sold on the promise of healthier babies — but what are the ethical concerns?
item.description: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it is still deeply controversial.

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025 — when is it, how to watch and who are the favourites for AFL's best-and-fairest award
item.description: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

item.title: The government says its 2035 climate targets are achievable but mathematics suggests a different story
item.description: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

item.title: Sarah Kopp's teacher Paul Grealy groomed her at 15. As an adult, she held him to account
item.description: Sarah Kopp's life was up-ended when a charismatic teacher twice her age started grooming her. Then they married and had children. When she sought justice 20 years on, she faced an impossible choice.

item.title: In an Australian first, chip company recycles leftover cooking oil into packaging to reduce emissions
item.description: Hundreds of litres of used cooking oil is disposed of every year as a by-product of making some of Australia's favourite snacks, like chips — but one company is trialling a method to reduce waste.

item.title: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Donald Trump says
item.description: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

item.title: Eleanor Patterson's 'bittersweet' moment of support for young rival at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Eleanor Patterson did not come away with a medal at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by supporting Angelina Topić through a tough moment, she gained so much more.

item.title: Scientists find physical exercise can reduce risk of developing dementia
item.description: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

item.title: Donald Trump has paid tribute to Charlie Kirk as a 'martyr' at a memorial service
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Charlie Kirk was a great American hero and a "martyr to American freedom", at a memorial to the right-wing activist.

item.title: Australia has been free of endemic measles since 2014. Could that change?
item.description: So far this year, there have been 121 measles notifications across Australia — the highest number since 2019, when there were 284 notifications.

item.title: Australian prime minister announces official recognition of Palestine
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Commuters taking converted e-bikes on NSW trains, metro to face fines
item.description: The e-bikes posing a "higher fire risk" will be banned from trains, after dozens of incidents were found to be linked to the battery technology powering them.

item.title: Charlie Kirk memorial at Arizona stadium
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: BOM forecasts sunny skies ahead for Queensland school holidays
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says the weather will be as good as people in the Sunshine State can hope for at this time of year, with another wet summer on the horizon.

item.title: Murray River flood may not be to blame for SA algal bloom, Senate inquiry hears
item.description: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

item.title: Tinder, Hinge ban for man convicted of possessing child abuse material welcomed by child safety advocate
item.description: A child safety advocate welcomes a recent decision to uphold a ban on a convicted child sex offender from two dating apps, which comes after the man tried to have the ban overturned.

item.title: Sydney underworld lawyer challenging police warrant over drug supply, guns claims
item.description: NSW Police issued a warrant for solicitor Abdul Saddik's devices earlier this year as part of a probe into his links to figures in Sydney's underworld.

item.title: Storm-damaged turbine at NSW Central West wind farm raises safety concerns
item.description: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW Nationals Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

item.title: Live updates: Wall Street rallies to another record high, ASX set to rise
item.description: All three key Wall Street indices hit record highs on Friday, buoyed by the Fed's rate cut last week. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Federal politics live: Australians should 'feel livid' about Optus triple-0 failure, communications minister says
item.description: Communications Minister Anika Wells says people have a right to "feel livid" following the latest Optus triple-0 outage. Follow live.

item.title: Ben Graetz is amplifying voices through drag and music
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sam Kerr earns a standing ovation in home game return as Chelsea defeats Leicester 1-0 in WSL
item.description: Chelsea fans stand and applaud Australian superstar Sam Kerr in her long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow in the WSL.

item.title: Worker dies after being struck by forklift in Sydney's east
item.description: The 57-year-old man was at a worksite in Sydney's east when he was seriously injured by a forklift.

item.title: Australian Jay Vine wins men's time trial silver in the world road cycling championships in Rwanda
item.description: Queenslander Jay Vine races to a silver medal in the men's time trial at the world road cycling championships in Rwanda.

item.title: This program could be the blueprint for helping kids fleeing domestic violence stay off the streets
item.description: Every night, thousands of Australian kids are homeless without an adult to look after them.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NT police data shows violent crime increasing, property crime decreasing
item.description: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.

item.title: Protesters in Philippines clash with police in rallies against corruption
item.description: Thousands of Filipinos marched in the capital to vent their anger over a ballooning scandal involving bogus flood-control projects believed to have cost taxpayers billions of dollars.

item.title: Queensland Police charge woman with defrauding four elderly residents at aged care facility where she worked
item.description: Police allege the woman defrauded four elderly residents at an aged care facility where she worked and used their bank details to make personal purchases.

item.title: World leaders are meeting at the UN General Assembly this week. Here are four things to watch for
item.description: World leaders are arriving in New York for the UN General Assembly — and for the first time, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among them.

item.title: Investigation into Optus triple-0 outage underway as minister warns there will be consequences
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority has begun its investigation into an Optus triple-0 outage that has been potentially linked to four deaths.
